All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AssetInputStreamFactory
A factory that creates input streams for asset files.
CertificateChecker
This class contains methods that checks whether the signature of the application is the expected signature.
DebugBlocker
This class provides a method to block native debuggers.
DebugBlocker.OnAttackListener
Interface to implement overriding its method onAttack() and passing on an object of the implementing class to the debugger blocking API, i.e., blockDebugger().
DebugDetector
This class provides a set of static methods enabling the detection of various debug-related application states.
EmulatorDetector
The EmulatorDetector class bundles various emulator detection techniques.
EncryptedCordovaWebViewClient
Deprecated.
EncryptedCordovaWebViewClient should only be used with old Cordova releases (< Cordova 4.0).
EncryptedSystemWebViewClient
This Cordova SystemWebViewClient can decrypt assets on the fly.
EncryptedWebViewClient
This web view client can decrypt assets on the fly.
EncryptedXWalkCordovaResourceClient
This XWalkCordovaResourceClient can decrypt assets on the fly.
HookDetector
This class contains a utility method to detect hooks in the runtime environment of the application, with frameworks like Frida.
PublicKeyTrustManager
A trust manager that only trusts servers whose public key hashes are all in the list of trusted public key hashes.
RootDetector
This class detects whether the device on which it is running is rooted.
RootDetector.Callback
Callback to process the results of the root detection checks.
SSLPinner
This class can pin HttpsURLConnection instances to only connect to trusted sources (e.g.
SSLPinningEncryptedSystemWebViewClient
The Cordova SystemWebViewClient can decrypt assets on the fly, while also pinning SSL connections to given certificates hashes.
SSLPinningSystemWebViewClient
This SystemWebViewClient pins SSL connections to given certificates hashes.
SSLPinningWebViewClient
This WebViewClient pins SSL connections to given certificates hashes.
VirtualEnvironmentDetector
This class contains a method to detect if the application is being run inside a virtual environment, e.g.
WrongSSLCertificateListener
Interface to implement when providing a callback to use when wrong certificates are detected.
